components.description:
A colorful lollipop made of swirled hard candy attached to a stick. Colors vary by platform, though most designs show rainbow colors or pinks and reds.

This emoji tends to spike in use around Halloween.

Samsung, Microsoft, and Facebook all used to have pink and red designs, but have since opted for rainbow colors.
components.title: Lollipop

description:
A colorful lollipop made of swirled hard candy attached to a stick. Colors vary by platform, though most designs show rainbow colors or pinks and reds.

This emoji tends to spike in use around Halloween.

Samsung, Microsoft, and Facebook all used to have pink and red designs, but have since opted for rainbow colors.
title: Lollipop

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Food symbol
emoji_net_data.definition: A lollipop: circular candy on a stick. Shown with a variety of colors (rainbow on Apple devices, yellow and pink for Android, pink on Window http://emojipedia.org/lollipop/
emoji_net_data.name: lollipop

bn:00111540a: Having or denoting the characteristic taste of sugar
Having the taste characteristic of sugar or honey.

bn:00111423a: Of food, drink, etc, containing or covered with a large amount of sugar
Covered with or containing a large amount of sugar.

bn:00091091v: To eat a snack or light meal.
To eat small things in between meals.

bn:00001880n: A sweet confection served as the last course of a meal
A dish served as the last course of a meal
A usage seen in the United Kingdom and some other Commonwealth countries.
Dessert is a typically sweet course that concludes an evening meal.
A sweet confection served as the last course of a meal.
Sweet confection served as the last course of a meal.
Sweet course that concludes a meal

bn:00010746n: The term "collation" originates in the Roman Catholic Church, where it refers to the two small meals allowed on days of fasting, with or without abstinence.

bn:00002794n: A lollipop is a type of confectionery consisting mainly of hardened, flavored sucrose with corn syrup mounted on a stick and intended for sucking or licking.
A piece of candy which is sucked; a lollipop.
A confectionery consisting of a piece of candy/sweet attached to a stick.

bn:00015227n: A rich, sweet, food item made of flavored sugar and often combined with fruit or nuts; a confection, comfit.
Edible, sweet-tasting confectionery containing sugar, or sometimes artificial sweeteners, and often flavored with fruit, chocolate, nuts, herbs and spices, or artificial flavors.
A rich sweet made of flavored sugar and often combined with fruit or nuts
An edible, sweet-tasting confection containing sugar.
Candy, also called sweets or lollies, is a confection that features sugar as a principal ingredient.

bn:00045726n: Ice cream or water ice on a small wooden stick
A popsicle, freeze pop, ice lolly, ice block, icy pole, chihiro, or ice pop is a water-based frozen snack.
A frozen snack consisting of flavoured ice in a tube; a freeze pop.
A flavored popsicle with an ice cream core.
A cold dessert or snack (made of water, combined with flavourings and sugar) that is popular when it's hot.

bn:00035650n: Any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body. For prepared ready-to-eat food, use dish: Q746549.
Any substance consumed by living organisms to sustain life.
Any substance that can be consumed by living organisms, especially by eating, in order to sustain life.
Any solid substance (as opposed to liquid) that is used as a source of nourishment
Food is any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body.
